_header: The Holy Rood the sweet tree right is to have in mind
Note: This is incorporated in the Laud ‘Sancta Crux’ — see 5337.
_description: The ‘Early History’ of the Cross in the South English Legendary

BodLauMis463.First Lines:
ÞE holy Rode þe swete treo right is to hauen in
                    mindeþat haþ fro strong y brought to liue al
                    mankynde…
BodLauMis463.Last Lines:
…So þat þilk stede was ffor lete many dayþat no
                    Cristen man ne paynym wiste where þe Rode lay
BodLauMis463.Note: Two columns per page, one full-line, the other half-line.

Bod779.First Lines:
Þe holy rode þe swete tre ryȝt is to habbe In
                    mendeþat haþ fram strong deþ I brouȝt to lyue alle
                    mankende…
Bod779.Last Lines:
…So þat þilke stede was for lete mony a dayþat
                    no cristinman ne payemens neyste were þe rode lay
Bod779.Attributed Title: Þe gynnyng of þe holy rode (f. 144v)

BodEngPoeta1.First Lines:
ÞE holy Rode þe swete treo riht is to hauen in
                    muyndeÞat haþ from strong deþ i brouht to lyue al
                    monkuynde…
BodEngPoeta1.Last Lines:
…So þat þulke stude was for let mony a dayÞat
                    no cristene mon ne Painym nuste where þe Rode lay
BodEngPoeta1.Facsimiles:
Doyle,  I. A.,
                        ed.  
             The Vernon Manuscript. A Facsimile of Bodleian Library, Oxford, MS Eng.
                poet.a.1,
          with an introduction by A. I. Doyle. Cambridge: D. S. Brewer, 1987. 
Scase,  Wendy,  and  Nick Kennedy, eds.  
             A facsimile edition of the Vernon manuscript: Oxford, Bodleian Library, MS. Eng. Poet. A. 1.
         Oxford: The Bodleian Library, 2011.
BodEngPoeta1.Editions:
Morris,  Richard,
                        ed.  
             Legends of the Holy Rood, Symbols of the Passion, and
                Cross-Poems.
EETS
         o.s. 46 (1871); repr. 1973: 18-35.

BodAsh43.First Lines:
þE holi rode þe swete tre riȝt is to habbe in
                    mundeþat haþ fram stronge deþ ibroȝt to lyue al
                    mankunde…
BodAsh43.Last Lines:
…So þat þulke stude was vorlete mony adayþat no
                    cristenmon ne paynym muste war þe rode lay
BodAsh43.Editions:
Morris,  Richard,
                        ed.  
             Legends of the Holy Rood, Symbols of the Passion, and
                Cross-Poems.
EETS
         o.s. 46 (1871); repr. 1973: 18-35.

BodTan17.First Lines:
The holi rode þe swete tre riȝt is to han in
                    myndeÞat haþ fro þe stronge deþ brouȝt to lyue al
                    man kynde…
BodTan17.Last Lines:
…So þat þe stede was forleten many a dayþat no
                    cristen man ne paynym wist not where þe rode lay
BodTan17.Note: No division between this and 133, which follows it in this MS.

CULAdd3039.First Lines:
Þe haly rode þat suet tre is gude to hafe in myndeffor
                    þurgh it fro dede to lyfe was broȝt al mankyndeÞurgh a tre
                    we were forlorne for syn þat adam wroȝtAnd þurgh a tre also
                    to lyfe þen were we broȝt…
CULAdd3039.Last Lines:
…Sithen at his t[ ]nce day theþen bod hym twynnea crewe
                    come & woned in þat ilk hous & fand þis croice
                    þerin…
CULAdd3039.Note: Text missing from middle and end due to loss of folios.

CamCCC145.First Lines:
ÞE holy rode þe swete tre riȝt is to habbe in
                    mundeÞat haþ fram strange deþ ibroȝt to lyue al man
                    kunde…
CamCCC145.Last Lines:
…So þat þulke stude was forlete many a dayÞat
                    no cristene man ne pain miste war þe rode lay
CamCCC145.Editions:
D’Evelyn,  Charlotte,  and  A. J. Mill, eds.  
             The South English Legendary: Corpus Christi College Cambridge MS. 145
                and British Museum MS. Harley 2277, with variants from Bodley MS. Ashmole 43 and
                British Museum MS. Cotton Julius D.ix.
EETS
         o.s. 235 (1959), 236 (1956); repr. 1967: 1.167.

CamMagPep2344.First Lines:
ÞE holy Rode day & þe swete treo riȝt hit is to haue
                    in mundeÞat ffram strong deþ brouȝte al
                    mankunde…
CamMagPep2344.Last Lines:
…So þat pulke stede was fforlete many a long dayÞat
                    no cristene man ne paym wuste whar þe rode lay

CamTCC605.First Lines:
HE holy rode þat swete tre goud is to habben in mundeþat
                    haþ from stronge deþ y broȝt al mankunde…
CamTCC605.Last Lines:
…Þus þulke stede was for lete many a dayso þat
                    cristen ne paynym niste ware þe rode lay
CamTCC605.Facsimiles:
Digital Facsimile of Trinity College Cambridge MS R.3.25.
         https://mss-cat.trin.cam.ac.uk/Manuscript/R.3.25.

BLCottJulDIX.First Lines: SE holi rode þat suete tre riȝt is to habbe in mendeþat haþ fro strong deþ ibroȝt to liue al mankende…
BLCottJulDIX.Last Lines: …so þat þilke stede was forlete moni a daiþat no cristenman ne payn nuste whare þe rode lai
BLCottJulDIX.Note: “Capitulum xxxviii” added to right margin by later hand (f. 67).
BLCottJulDIX.Facsimiles:
Digital Facsimile of British Library  Cotton Julius MS D IX.
         https://www.bl.uk/manuscripts/FullDisplay.aspx?ref=Cotton_MS_Julius_D_IX.

BLEge1993.First Lines: Þe holi Rode þat swete treo god is to habbe in mindeÞat haþ vram strong deþ wrouȝt al monkinde…
BLEge1993.Last Lines: …Þus þilke stude was vorleten mani a dayÞat oþer cristene ne paynim nuste whar þe rode lay

BLEge2810.First Lines: ÞE holie rode þat swete tre riȝt it is to habbe in mundeþat haþ fram strong deþe ybroȝt to liue alle mankunde…
BLEge2810.Last Lines: …So þat þulk stede was vor lete manie a dayþat no cristenman no paynim nust war þe rod lay
BLEge2810.Note: Second occurence in this manuscript; f. 188 is a half-sized strip of parchment bound in sideways.

BLEge2891.First Lines: ÞE holy rode þat swete treo riȝt is to habbe in mundeþat haþ fram strange deþ ibroȝt to lyue al mankunde…
BLEge2891.Last Lines: …So þat þulke stude was for lete many adayþat no cristene man ne pain nuste ware þe rode lay
BLEge2891.Attributed Title: Inuencio sancte crucis (rubric in margin, f. 73)

BLHar2250.First Lines:
The holy rode þat swete tre gode is to haue in myndeÞat
                    has fro strong dethe broȝt to life al monkynde…
BLHar2250.Last Lines:
…He ordent þen his moer thurgh hor botheres specheffor to
                    wende to Ierusalem þe holy rode to seche

BLHar2277.First Lines: ÞE holi Rode þe suete treo riȝt is to habbe in mundeþat haþ fram Stronge deþe ibroȝt to lyue al man cunde…
BLHar2277.Last Lines: …So þat þulke stede was forȝute meni odaiþat no cristene man ne payn nuste whar þe Rode lai
BLHar2277.Facsimiles:
Digital Facsimile of British Library Harley MS 2277.
         https://www.bl.uk/manuscripts/FullDisplay.aspx?index=0&ref=Harley_MS_2277.

BLAdd10301.First Lines:
ÞE holy Rode þat swete tre riȝt is to haue in
                    mundeþat haþ fram strange deþ y broȝt to lyue al man
                    kunde…
BLAdd10301.Last Lines:
…So þat þulke stude was vor lete mani a dayþat
                    no cristen man ne payn niste ware þe Rode lay
BLAdd10301.Attributed Title:
De inuencione sancte crucis (f. 75, by scribe in margin beside first
                    line); Sancte crucis, Inuencione sancte crucis (RT)

Lam223.First Lines:
Thurgh a tre we were forlorn & first broȝt to groundeAnd
                    þurȝ atre to lyf broȝt heried be þat
                    stounde…
Lam223.Last Lines:
…So þat þe place by tyme forlett was mony a
                    dayÞat cristen men ne heþen nist where þe Rode
                    lay

LeedsBro501.First Lines:
The holy Rode the swete tre ys good to haf in myndeffor thurgh it
                    fro deth to lyue was broght al mankyndeThurgh a tre we were for lorn thurgh
                    syn þat adam wroght And thurgh a tre also to lyf were we
                    broght…
LeedsBro501.Last Lines:
…Now Ihesu thurgh thy holy Rode Schylde vs fro the fendeAnd
                    bryng vs to that mekyll ioye that neuyr shal haf ende
LeedsBro501.Attributed Title:
Here begynnyth a proces & a declaracion of the holy cros how it was [ ]
                    of cernelys the wiche cam fro paradys & þan of the myraclys of the cros
                    as ye shal here aftyrward (f. 107); Explicit virtus sancte crucis (f.
                        101v)

TokyoTak54.First Lines:
The holy rood þat swete tre Right is to haue in myndeÞat
                    haþ þus from deth brouȝt to lyf al mankynde…
TokyoTak54.Last Lines:
…So þat place was forlete many a longe dayÞat
                    Cristen man neiþere paynyme nyst where þe rode lay
